intro: Randia uranthera, commonly known as the golden balsam, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. Randia uranthera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and thrives in partial to full sunlight.
